docs.text: SPRINT4.0 Benvenuto nella repository del progetto SPRINT4.0. L'obiettivo di questa repository è servire al team come strumento per tenere traccia delle attività di gestione del progetto SPRINT4.0 . Tale strumento è una versione beta per testare tale metodologia di gestione di progetti.
docs.title: SPRINT4.0

docs.text: WBS - Work Breakdown Structure La seguente tabella mostra le attività interne di gestione del progetto SPRINT4.0 relative all' Università di Pisa . TaskID Level_0 Level_1 Description AD.TI ADMIN TIMESHEET Registrazione e contabilizzazione delle ore lavorative AD.BU ADMIN BUDGETING Registrazione e contabilizzazione delle spese generate e previsionali AD.EV ADMIN EVENTS Attività legate alla logistica dei diversi eventi AD.MI ADMIN VIAGGI E MISSIONI Attività legate alla ai viaggi e alle missioni CO.WE COMMUNICATION WEB SITE Attività che coinvolgono l'aggiornamento del sito web del progetto CO.MA COMMUNICATION MARKETING PLAN Attività di comunicazione e marketing CO.ST COMMUNICATION STUDENTI COMUNICAZIONE Attività legate alla raccolta di iscrizioni degli studenti CO.FO COMMUNICATION FOTO E VIDEO Produzione di materiale multimediale durante i corsi CO.IN COMMUNICATION INTERNAL COMMUNICATION Comunicazioni interne con docenti e studenti del corso di Unipi CO.EX COMMUNICATION EXTERNAL COMMUNICATION Comunicazioni esterne con i parners del progetto TR.LE TRAINING LEXICON Attività di creazione dei contenuti del corso TR.SE TRAINING SELECTION PROCESS Attività di selezione degli studenti e formazione dei gruppi TR.DO TRAINING DOCENZA Attività di reclutamento docenti TR.BU TRAINING BUROCRAZIA GENERALE Attività burocratiche generali varie
docs.title: WBS - Work Breakdown Structure

docs.text: [AD.BU.0] Procedura per spese extra universitarie I passi da seguire sono i seguenti: Il professore deve generare un ordine web tramite il portale. L' ordine web ha solamente valenza amministrativa interna del DICI e serve per bloccare i fondi L'azienda alla quale si richiede il servizio deve generare un preventivo Il preventivo generato dall'azienda dev'essere stampato e portato in Segreteria Amministrativa del DICI al terzo piano dalla signora Lucia o Cinzia dove verrà generato un ordine generale . Quest'ordine viene inviato all'azienda, che emetterà una fattura elettronica la quale il Dipartimento provvederà a pagare.
docs.title: Budgeting

docs.text: [AD.EV.1] Servizio Ristorazione Segreteria Mensa Centrale Franca Puntoni fpuntoni@dsu.toscana.it Per fornire servizio di ristorazione ai partner per il progetto SPRINT4.0 è necessario acquistare dei buoni pasto al servizio DSU Ristorazione, deducibili dai fondi del progetto. I passi da seguire sono i seguenti: Il professore deve generare un ordine web tramite il portale. L' ordine web ha solamente valenza amministrativa interna del DICI e serve per bloccare i fondi È necessario inviare una mail all’indirizzo ristorazione.pi@dsu.toscana.it indicando: introduzione di 2 righe sull’iniziativa, tipologia di progetto e motivazione della richiesta indicazione sulla durata del corso, specificando i giorni in cui sono necessari i buoni pasto indicare il numero e la tipologia di partecipanti (consultare qui ) indicare il numero di buoni pasto necessari La stima è di 100 buoni pasto (10 partner x 2 pasti/gg x 5 gg). In risposta alla mail verrà inviato un modulo che dovrà essere compilato con le specificità della richiesta e gli estremi per la fatturazione. 3. Il modulo generato dal DSU dev'essere stampato e portato in Segreteria Amministrativa del DICI al terzo piano dalla signora Lucia o Cinzia dove verrà generato un ordine generale . 4. Quest'ordine viene inviato alla ditta, in questo caso il DSU, che emetterà una fattura elettronica la quale il Dipartimento provvederà a pagare. [AD.EV.2] Prenotazione Aulee Il corso SPRINT4.0 dovrà avere luogo presso le aulee di Ingegneria dell'Università. Capienza [ stima ]: n. 40 studenti 6 partner provenienti dalle aziende 2 università estere 2 tech providers 2 Unipisa 52 posti totali (minimo) A fronte delle necessità di materiale e della capienza stimata è opportuno prenotare le aulee del polo PN (Porta Nuova). Dato che le aulee PN9 e PN10 il 24 Settembre saranno occupate tutto il giorno dagli esami di Stato, si farà richiesta di prenotazione dell'aula PN8 la cui capienza di 178 posti risulta essere adeguata per il corso. Sono state effettuate due richieste NON andate a buon fine per la prenotazione delle aulee. 1. Prenotazione tramite il portale indicando come richiedente il prof Fantoni http://www.ing.unipi.it/it/la-scuola/prenotazione-aule-e-aule-magne 2. Inviando la seguente mail Contenuto Mail Nicola Melluso nicolamelluso@gmail.com 13 mag 2019, 15:09 a: elena.tonsini, Gualtiero, Ccn: Anna Salve, sono Nicola Melluso, responsabile gestionale del progetto ERASMUS+ Settore Istruzione Superiore "SPRINT4.0" (codice progetto 2017-1-IT02-KA203-036980) e la contatto a nome del coordinatore del progetto, prof. Gualtiero Fantoni. La contatto per chiederle informazioni in merito alla prenotazione dell'aula PN8 nella settimana dal 23/9/2019 al 27/9/2019. Nel sistema di prenotazione di aule disponibile a questo link, in merito al progetto in questione, quale opzione è necessario scegliere tra quelle indicate nella tipologia? Per poter richiedere l'aula per tutta la settimana, è necessario generare richieste diverse per ogni giorno della settimana? La ringrazio per la cortese attenzione. Cordiali saluti Nicola TO-DO Recarsi in segreteria per contattare la signora Tonsini.
docs.title: Events

docs.text: Strategic Partnership for Industry 4.0 innovation advanced Training ![](data:image/*;base64,) | Third partnership meeting minutes Bremen, 26-27.03.2019 Meeting agenda Day 1 - Tuesday 26.03.2019 09:15 – 09:20 Welcome URL 09:20 – 09:25 Presentation of the agenda UNIPI 09.25 – 09.30 Revision of the project UNIPI 09:30 – 09:40 Collective verification of the Training Course Action Plan UNIPI 09:40 – 10:20 Presentation of the common parts developed by the Universities/companies: - --BIBA: Introduction about enterprise 4.0 (5 min) - --URL: 360 degrees of digitalization (5 min) - --Great Products: Market and business model understanding (5 min) - --UNIPI: Audit methodology (5 min) - --URL: Why should I implement a specific technology? (5 min) And discussion (15 min) Involved partners 10:20 – 10:50 Presentation of one example of the use cases template and discussion TOI 10:50 – 11:10 Break 11:10 – 11:40 Update about the preparation of the specific training course materials (IO2, IO3, IO4, 5 min each) and identification of possible support (uses cases) from the companies UNIPI, BIBA, URL 11:40 – 12:10 Presentation of the evaluation tool and discussion FGB 12:10 – 12:50 Advertising the course: recruitment strategies, advertisement materials: what we have, what we need FGB 12:50 – 14:00 Lunch 14:00 – 15:30 Presentation of the companies challenges adopting the "Partner company presentation" (short version) and discussion for improvements. At the end of each presentation, partnership comments on the additional informative materials collected by the companies (15 mins for challenge; 30 mins per partner) SELETTRA, BARNA, OHS 15:30 – 17:00 Presentation of the Pretoype Competition Action Plan UNIPI Participants: Nicola Melluso and Anna Natelli , UniPi Robert Hellbach , BIBA Agustín Zaballos and Alan Briones Delgado, URL Alessandro Guadagni and Luigi Cerfeda , TOI Michele Santucci and Enzo Diletti , Selettra Debora Grieco , FGB Jordi Pelfort , Barna Steel Carl Hans and Shobhit Gupta , OHS Ilaria Tagliavini and Claudia Giua, Intooition/Great Product were connected via telco Welcome; Presentation of the agenda; Revision of the project, collective verification of the Training Course Action Plan Robert gives the welcome speech to the partners. Before starting the meeting, Ilaria (Intooition/GP), connected via skype, explains why she couldn't be in person in Bremen: at the moment being, a new company (Great Product) acquired Intooition, but the new company hasn't confirmed yet if they still can/want to be partner in the project. The decision about this will be taken in the next weeks, when the internal situation of Intooition/GP will be defined. In the meantime, Ilaria volunteered to contribute to the meeting development. Alessandro (TOI) presents some slide about the current status of the project : what the partnership has done so far, what the partnership will have to do in next months. The dates of the training course are now defined: UniPi - Production system automation: Mon 23.09.2019 – Fri 27.09.2019, from 09.00 to 16.00 BIBA - Industrial IoT: Mon 02.09.2019 – Fri 06.09.2019, from 10.00 to 16.30 URL - Data and Security: Mon 08.07.2019 – Fri 12.07.2019, from 16.00 to 21.00 Partners can start buying travel tickets and reserving the accommodation. URL will give logistic support, if needed. The students' mobility should take place in March 2020 for the Italian students, in February 2020 for the German students, in October 2019 for the Spanish students. After a long discussion about the challenges, the partners decide to choose before the beginning of the course, one challenge that will be adopted for explaining the students what a prototype is ("trial challenge") and show them another challenge ("real challenge") that will be object of the actual and sole competition. Due to this new decision, which does not affect the quality of the program and is in line with what the partners declared in the Application form, the overall course architecture should be adjusted. UniPi will revise the Training course Action Plan and will send a new version of the document by 10.04.2019. According to the new architecture, BIBA and URL will adjust their detailed training schedule. Presentation of the common parts developed by the Universities/companies --BIBA: Introduction about enterprise 4.0. Partnership__Feedback: Robert suggests the change of the name of this session from "Enterprise 4.0" to "Industry 4.0". The partners ask Robert to introduce a new slide for creating a link from this introduction to the other presentations/topics. --URL: 360 degrees of digitalization . Partnership__Feedback: the slides are ok. --Great Products: Market and business model understanding. Intooition/GP will present the slides soon --UNIPI: Audit methodology . Partnership__Feedback : the number of slides is too high for a 30 min presentation; UniPi should stress that the students can refer to IO1 (downloadable on the project website) for getting all the information about how to conduct a 4.0 audit. --URL: Why should I implement a specific technology? Partnership__Feedback: URL asks for a feedback from the companies about the 5 questions they put in the final slides. Partners will give a comment, if any, before the start of the course. Presentation of one example of the use cases template and discussion Luigi (TOI) presents the first use case to present in the course: "An innovative Waste-management system based on the acquisition of biogas data". This Use Case is referred to Data and Security topic. This presentation is also conceived as a test of the template prepared by Intooition. Main feedback on the template: --Luigi suggests not to use all the slides, but just the ones that are more relevant for the use case (for example, for this presentation he focused on internal processes, skipping other topics, such as stakeholders); --Regarding the specific company markets, Luigi could not get info from the company, so he made researches on internet: he suggests do this in case the other partners will have problem in getting this information; --Claudia (Intooition/GP) thinks that TOI should give more information on the state of the art of the technology descripted, on the solutions already available on the market and on the economic impact of the introduction of the new data acquisition method. It is important to understand if there is an economic impact, even without using numbers, but still giving an overview of the advantages and benefits of the company; --Alan (URL) asks for adding some slides about security related issues, in order to introduce this topic for their students. Luigi (TOI) will add the above mentioned suggestions in the new version of this use case (deadline: 18.03.2019). The partners agree on having all the use cases for the Introduction to the courses prepared by TOI. TOI will revise the use case on Biogas (especially meant for introducing "Big Data and Security" course) and will prepare two new presentations: one on Industrial refrigeration (specifically targeted on IIoT topic) and one on Manufacturing Industry (specifically targeted on "Production system automation" topic). The presentations will be standard, but Universities could ask to focus on some specific aspects when referring to the topic to be addressed in their course in order to introduce exercises/practical sessions for their students. Universities will ask to companies to provide them use cases if needed, but in general the exercises should be based TOI will deliver the 3 presentations by 10.05.2019. The partners will revise the materials and provide feedback on the standard slides by 17.05.2019. All the other modifications (specifically based on the specific needs of the Universities), will be agreed bilaterally by the involved partners. Update about the preparation of the specific training course materials and identification of possible support (uses cases) from the companies Robert (BIBA), Alan (URL) and Nicola (UniPi) presents the structure of the courses they designed. The overall architecture will be reviewed by UniPi considering the decision about the "trial" and "real" challenges, all the other partners will modify the specific schedules accordingly (Deadline UniPi: 10.04.2019). Alan will contact directly TOI and Intooition/GP for asking them the technologies he could introduce in the course and agreeing on the presentations. TOI will also prepare a more detailed version of the Data and Security use case (biogas) which will be the starting point for some exercises. Robert (BIBA) asks TOI to make a practical workshop of 90 minutes on their technologies. Luigi accepts; BIBA will contact directly Luigi for getting information about the equipment TOI needs for the implementation of the workshop. Nicola (UNIPI) asks to Luigi (TOI) to give a presentation on the 4.0box and the 4.0platform, in order to present these tools to the students. Luigi accepts; UniPi will liaise with Luigi for organizing the training sessions. Nicola (UNIPI) asks to Carl (OHS) to give a presentation on a use case on Automatic Maintenance, following the common template of the use cases. Carl accepts. Carl will provide the slides to UNIPI by 10.05.2019 and UNIPI will revise the material and provide feedback by 17.05.2019. The partners confirm the idea of choosing one idea as "trial" challenge, focusing more on technological aspects, and one "real" challenge, focusing also on business aspects (as provided by the prEtotype template that will be presented by Intooition/GP on the second day). Presentation of the companies challenges adopting the "Partner company presentation" (short version) and discussion for improvements Carl presents OHS and the two challenges ("Autmation Production System" and "Data & Security"), adopting the template. In general, Alessandro (TOI) thinks that the template should be used for giving a support to the companies for presenting the challenges, always considering that the students will also have the challenge canvas with the very core information. The slides should be a way for allowing the companies to tell a story to the students, explaining who they are (company presentation) and what they need (challenges). Carl (OHS) needs to rework the presentation to shorten it. He needs to add more information about the market data. Enzo presents Selettra and the two challenges ( IIoT and Data & Security ). Enzo had problems in filling the general presentation of the company, as it was not clear to him what market data and value chain meant. He suggests change the wording of the slide on "obstacles", adopting rather the terms "limits" or "boundaries". Ilaria (Intooition/GP) remarks that it is important for the students to have a wide picture of the company and its business model. The students should frame the company in its value chain, in order to provide solutions which are aligned with the company and that can be actually implemented. Ilaria explains that companies does not need to provide much detailed info about the market, but it is important to make the students understand what the companies really need. Jordi presents Barna Steel and the two challenges ( IIoT and Automation production system ). Jordi proposes to add a slide with "failures", explaining previous experiences which brought to no results. Jordi thinks that the challenge on the Exoskeleton could be not strategic any more for Barna Steel. By 05.04.2019 he will give UniPi a final answer about the challenge: if maintaining it or replacing it with another one, and which one. By 19.04.2019 Barna Stell will provide UniPi with the final version of the challenge they want to present in Pisa. Feedback on the use of the template provided by Intooition/GP The partners can take the small logos out. They are invited to add other pictures related to the contents they present Slide "Value chain": Intooition/GP will provide a more precise description and guide for filling this slide Slide "Key market data": one slide is enough, with key information about what the company feels it is important about their sector. Slide "Processes": in the current version of the presentations, there are many differences among partners. This slide should be more detailed (OHS could be considered as a good example), students need to understand clearly the workflow, they should understand exactly how the companies do things and what it is expected from them as improvement. Selettra should improve consistently the presentation, as at the moment being it is difficult to understand the process and how the tools they have are actually working. Slide "Stakeholder": students do not need a list of the people involved as stakeholder, but they need to understand the information workflow. The example to take is the slide that OHS prepared. Slide "Impact": it is important for the students to know which is the impact expected and they should have the idea of measurable indicators. How to measure the impact? This would be an important info for understanding the challenge and this would allow the students to provide solutions that can represent an actual added value for companies. Exoskeleton: it is more a solution than a challenge. Ilaria thinks that a possibile challenge on this topic could focus on the problem of handling or moving certain materials in the specific environment of the company. Hence the students will provide a solution among the technologies tackled during the course. Deadlines: Intooition/GP will send an updated version of the company description presentation by 29.03.2019 Companies will define the new version of the slides and the canvas of the Challenges by 19.04.2019. If needed the Universities can contact the companies for receiving additional information from the companies. Both the presentation and the canvas should be completed and released in an ultimate version by that deadline. Partners decided which is the "real challenge" and the "trial challenge". The picture is here below. The University partners are also asked to provide the dates for the University coaching and the expected dates for the mobility here . According to this scheme: --SELETTRA will present the trial challenge for the students of the Spanish course (Data and Security) and the real challenge for the students of the German course (IIoT) --OHS will present the trial challenge for the students of the Italian course (Production system automation) and the real challenge for the students of the Spanish course (Data and Security) --Barna Steel will present the trial challenge for the students of the German course (IIoT) and the real challenge for the students of the Italian course (Production system automation) This means that: --UniPi will present the challenge of OHS as trial challenge and the challenge of Barna Steel as real challenge --BIBA will present the challenge of Barna Steel as trial challenge and the challenge of SELETTRA as real challenge --URL will present the challenge of Selettra as trial challenge and the challenge of OHS as real challenge Presentation of the Pretoype Competition Action Plan Nicola (UniPi) presents the PrEtotype Action Plan (full document here ). The summary of the open issues and partners feedback/partnership decisions is here below: Presentation of what is a PrEtotype : this presentation will be prepared by UniPi; partners will allocate 1 hour for this. Deadline: updated version for partners check: 30.04.2019; ultimate version after partnership validation by 31.05.2019 Group creation : partners discuss about the methodology proposed by UniPi for creating the groups. Robert agrees on the rationale for the proposal (Universities contribute significantly to the creation of the groups, taking students from different Faculties), but he thinks it will be difficult for them to have people coming from many different Faculties. URL suggests the Universities creating the groups, without asking to the students. Universities will be free of deciding which is the most effective way for creating the groups, taking into account the proposal of UniPi. Output for the "trial" and "real" challenges : a) Trial challenges have a flexible output, it should be focused on technologies and ideas. Robert suggests to a have as output a quick pitch on a single page output to be evaluated by the other students ("shark-tank" methodology). Robert (BIBA) will provide a draft procedure for this exercise by 10.04.2019. b) Real challenges : slide presentation, based on the template prepared by Intooition/GP and to be presented on the 2 nd day of the meeting. How to evaluate the challenges : UniPi will prepare a grid starting from the set of common criteria already listed in the Pretotype Action Plan. UniPi will introduce other criteria, such as the quality of the presentations. The "selection panel" for the challenges will be composed of: - - - 1 representative from the Target Company - 1 representative from the Tech Providers (TOI for the IIoT and Data and Security course; Intooition/GP for Automation system) - 1 representative from the host University How to provide support in the month after the course : - - - by email, through a contact person ( tutor ) for each University - participating in individual sessions just in the case that the issues couldn't be solved through email changes The period for the preparation of the challenges and the day for the presentations are defined by the Universities, which are invited to provide this here . Final session , presentation of the pretotypes : each group presents the slides for the prEtotype developed. Presentations should last 10 min + 5 min Q&A. The presentation could be done in one single event or in two events (expecting 10 groups of 4 people, the total duration of the final session should be around 3 hours). The presentation will be given at the venue of the host University and broadcasted on skype in order to have all the selection panel members able to see it. How to select the students participating in the mobility : students will be free of deciding who is going to participate in the mobility experience. If in the winning group there is no one (or just one) member interested in the mobility, the Universities can decide to select other students from other groups, following the final rank. In general, partnership decide to give priority to the possibility of granting students with the possibility of the transnational experience. It is compulsory that the students participating in the mobility must be linked to the organization granting them (e.g. they are officially enrolled). Meeting agenda Day 2 - Wednesday 27.03.2019 Timing 09:00 – 10:00 10:00 – 12:00(with break) 12:00 – 12:20 12:20 – 13:00 Participants: Nicola Melluso and Anna Natelli , UniPi Robert Hellbach , BIBA Agustín Zaballos and Alan Briones Delgado, URL Alessandro Guadagni and Luigi Cerfeda , TOI Michele Santucci and Enzo Diletti , Selettra Debora Grieco , FGB Jordi Pelfort , Barna Steel Carl Hans and Shobhit Gupta , OHS Ilaria Tagliavini and Claudia Giua, Intooition/Great Product were connected via telco Ilaria presents the template aimed at guiding the students in presenting their prEtotype. The inspiration for the slide template for the prEtotype competition comes from the typical business pitch. What can be changed, according to the partners needs, is the level of detail we should ask the students. The presentation is organized in 6 slides: the first one is related to the market (value chain, etc.); the second one is on competitive scenarios; then the state-of-the-art (students shouldn't reinvent the wheel, partners should ask them to make a problem statement, also analyising what other organizations have already done); proposed solution; innovation provided; impact; implementation (i.e. preliminary presentation of the next steps). Main feedback: -- Costs and benefits : students will be not provided with any specific knowledge on this during the course, so we should expect many questions on this issue. Nicola and Alan suggest avoid focusing too much on "economic costs", and stressing the time effort needed to implement their solution -- Innovation : Robert suggests replace the TRL with the Integration Readiness Level (IRL) After the discussion done as brainstorming in IO5 session, the partners suggest Intooition/GP to reformulate the slide Implementation in order to include questions like: what would be your first steps in the company if you will win the competition? This slide should be conceived as preparatory for the output of the University coaching. Partners agree that this slide will be an important point of evaluation for the winning group since it is crucial to assess the readiness and the motivation of the students in participating at the mobility. Partners will check again the template, also taking into account the evaluation criteria defined for the evaluation of the winning team and will give a feedback by 10.04.2019. Presentation of the evaluation tool and discussion Debora (FGB) presents the draft questionnaire FGB prepared for assessing the feedback of the students for each training day and for the whole course . The aim of these questionnaires is collecting information for revising the course and delivering the final version of IO2, IO3 and IO4. The questionnaires are easy and user-friendly, they can be also done on mobile. FGB will be responsible for asking the students to complete the questionnaire at the end of each single day. --Alan (URL) suggests adopt the platform " Socrative " to store all the questionnaires. The students will just need to connect to that platform to find the questionnaire on each day and the one on the full course. --Carl (OHS) asks for having a section where the students can leave open comments and feedback in case they believe that the course objectives were not reached. --Robert (BIBA) suggests to add in questionnaire about the whole course. For example, a space for asking to the students to rate the degree of attainment of each learning outcome. FGB will add this question, adopting all the learning outputs defined in the course syllabi prepared by the Universities. --Robert (BIBA) also suggest to add the question "what would you change in the course"? Advertising the course: recruitment strategies, advertisement materials: what we have, what we need Debora presents the available channel and resources for advertising the course: at the moment being, partners have 3 social channels ( Facebook , Twitter , LinkedIn – to be opened) and the website . These channels should be exploited to reach the students. Robert (BIBA) asks for the flyer in an editable version, so to adapt it to their course and sending email to their students, with a tailor-made information for recruiting them for the course. UNIPI will also create a Linkedin group for reaching the students which are already registered. Revision of the flyer: adding the fact that there is possibility of having a fully paid transnational mobility. Brainstorming on IO5: Coaching methodologies (Technology coaching – Universities; Application oriented coaching – Companies) for empowering competencies and for elaborating prototypes according to Industry 4.0 The first question asked by Nicola (UniPi) is: what do the companies expect from the students at the end of the mobility? --Enzo (Selettra): he expects the students to be able to provide ideas and solutions to solve the problems presented by the company during the challenge. --Jordi (Barna Steel): he expects, at the end of the path, to have a proof of concept to be further developed, in other words a deeper analysis of the problem and a number of ideas for actually solving it. --Carl (OHS) has the same objectives. He hopes the students will be able to work within the company with a good degree of autonomy and organize their work by themselves. For sure, he will provide them with all the support they need, but it is important for them to develop also autonomy as a skill. Alan (URL) believes that the students should just solve a part of the problem, and provide for this part a proof of concept, transforming the pretotype presented in the competition and developed thanks to the Technology coaching (host University) into a prototype (thanks to the company coaching). The students should prove that the problem is solvable; the company will then have the chance for completing the work. - - Technology Coaching (within the University) : the output of this first kind of coaching should be a preliminary action/project plan, to be deployed for real during the transnational mobility within the company. The Project Plan could be composed of: --WPs/Phases with at least one output per each phase and/or list of tasks organized on a weekly base --GANTT chart --Expected effort expressed in time --List of resources needed --The expected impact in the company (improvements) - - Application oriented coaching (within the Company) : the output should be a proof of concept, to be further developed by the company. While in the Technology Coaching phase the students will plan the work to do ( planning ), in the Application oriented coaching they will implement the plan ( doing ). During the mobility the students should also focus on business aspects, dedicating at least a couple of days for understanding and defining the business prospective of the prototype developed in the previous days. To do this, the students could be asked to carry out a SWOT analysis (or some more sophisticate tool) for defining how the company business could be changed by the introduction of the protoyped solution. Also the stakeholder analysis could be useful to understand the external relations that could be created in a following implementation phase The results of this brainstorming should be conceived just as suggestion for the organization(s) responsible for preparing these methodologies (being Intootion/GP or other organizations in case they should leave the partnership). As the first coaching will take place in September in Spain (duration: 1 month, after the end of the course and summer break, more info here ), the methodologies should be ready by the end of July. A more detailed plan will be prepared when the decision about the partner organizations wil be taken. Recap on financial and administrative rules related to the Teaching and students mobilities for participating in the 3 training courses Alessandro (TOI) presents the financial rules, which are fully described in the slides here . University and companies are asked to understand if there are any specific administrative rules they need to comply with for sending out/hosting the students. The University could also check with their Erasmus+ internal offices if there are any specific rules to follow for the students mobility. In case of need, they can always refer to UniPi for support and counselling. Companies might also ask the students to sign a Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA). UniPi will provide the partners with the common documents for the mobility, such as a template agreement between the Universities and the students, the learning agreement for the students (linking the University, the students and the company) and the template Europass certificate, for certifying the skills developed during the mobility. It could be also useful to give the students a certificate of attendance (as required by the financial rules of the program) and a Job Reference/Testimonial certificate (for enriching the CVs) Planning next steps, training mobilites, students mobilities and next meeting (Dec 2019 – Barcelona, host by Barna) Next steps: --UniPi revise of the Training course Action Plan: 10.05.2019 --Barna informs UniPi about the challenge to replace (or not) the exoskeleton challenge: 05.04.2019 --Preparation of Training course common materials (UniPi, URL, BIBA, Intooition/GP) and common Introduction to PrEtotype (UniPI): updated version for partners check: 30.04.2019; ultimate version after partnership validation by 31.05.2019. --BIBA prepares a draft proposal for presenting the output of the "trial" challenge. 10.04.2019 --OHS will prepare a a presentation on a use case on Automatic Maintenance, following the common template of the use cases by 10.05.2019. UNIPI will revise the material and provide feedback by 17.05.2019. --Preparation of the use cases (TOI): first version for partners check: 10.05.2019; partners check the materials by 17.05.2019. Universities can ask for specific improvements with the purpose of introducing practical exercises on the use case issues. --Luigi (TOI) will contact BIBA and URL for organizing workshops and the other training pars to be delivered by TOI --Any additional materials needed by the Universities from TOI or other partners: based on direct contacts among the involved partners --Final version of companies presentations and challenges canvas: 19.04.2019 --Course structure and syllabus defined by the universities: 31.05.2019. Partners will prepare the related training materials basing on internal deadlines (clearly, the final deadline for this is the begin of the course) --Coaching methodologies (University and Company): first draft by 30.04.2019, delivery of an improved version by 31.05.2019; the partners will take advantage of the gathering for the URL training course (Mon 08.07.2019 – Fri 12.07.2019) --FGB send an updated version of the evaluation and communication tools: 12.04.2019 Next meeting should take place in December, partnership will agree on the dates. The meeting should be hosted by Barna Steel, but the Spanish partners are invited to discuss if it would be possible to choose as meeting venue URL premises, so to avoid logistic difficulties to the other partners.
docs.title: Meeting

docs.text: Bremen, 26-27.03.2019 Meeting agenda Day 1 - Tuesday 26.03.2019 09:15 – 09:20 Welcome URL 09:20 – 09:25 Presentation of the agenda UNIPI 09.25 – 09.30 Revision of the project UNIPI 09:30 – 09:40 Collective verification of the Training Course Action Plan UNIPI 09:40 – 10:20 Presentation of the common parts developed by the Universities/companies: - --BIBA: Introduction about enterprise 4.0 (5 min) - --URL: 360 degrees of digitalization (5 min) - --Great Products: Market and business model understanding (5 min) - --UNIPI: Audit methodology (5 min) - --URL: Why should I implement a specific technology? (5 min) And discussion (15 min) Involved partners 10:20 – 10:50 Presentation of one example of the use cases template and discussion TOI 10:50 – 11:10 Break 11:10 – 11:40 Update about the preparation of the specific training course materials (IO2, IO3, IO4, 5 min each) and identification of possible support (uses cases) from the companies UNIPI, BIBA, URL 11:40 – 12:10 Presentation of the evaluation tool and discussion FGB 12:10 – 12:50 Advertising the course: recruitment strategies, advertisement materials: what we have, what we need FGB 12:50 – 14:00 Lunch 14:00 – 15:30 Presentation of the companies challenges adopting the "Partner company presentation" (short version) and discussion for improvements. At the end of each presentation, partnership comments on the additional informative materials collected by the companies (15 mins for challenge; 30 mins per partner) SELETTRA, BARNA, OHS 15:30 – 17:00 Presentation of the Pretoype Competition Action Plan UNIPI Participants: Nicola Melluso and Anna Natelli , UniPi Robert Hellbach , BIBA Agustín Zaballos and Alan Briones Delgado, URL Alessandro Guadagni and Luigi Cerfeda , TOI Michele Santucci and Enzo Diletti , Selettra Debora Grieco , FGB Jordi Pelfort , Barna Steel Carl Hans and Shobhit Gupta , OHS Ilaria Tagliavini and Claudia Giua, Intooition/Great Product were connected via telco Welcome; Presentation of the agenda; Revision of the project, collective verification of the Training Course Action Plan Robert gives the welcome speech to the partners. Before starting the meeting, Ilaria (Intooition/GP), connected via skype, explains why she couldn't be in person in Bremen: at the moment being, a new company (Great Product) acquired Intooition, but the new company hasn't confirmed yet if they still can/want to be partner in the project. The decision about this will be taken in the next weeks, when the internal situation of Intooition/GP will be defined. In the meantime, Ilaria volunteered to contribute to the meeting development. Alessandro (TOI) presents some slide about the current status of the project : what the partnership has done so far, what the partnership will have to do in next months. The dates of the training course are now defined: UniPi - Production system automation: Mon 23.09.2019 – Fri 27.09.2019, from 09.00 to 16.00 BIBA - Industrial IoT: Mon 02.09.2019 – Fri 06.09.2019, from 10.00 to 16.30 URL - Data and Security: Mon 08.07.2019 – Fri 12.07.2019, from 16.00 to 21.00 Partners can start buying travel tickets and reserving the accommodation. URL will give logistic support, if needed. The students' mobility should take place in March 2020 for the Italian students, in February 2020 for the German students, in October 2019 for the Spanish students. After a long discussion about the challenges, the partners decide to choose before the beginning of the course, one challenge that will be adopted for explaining the students what a prototype is ("trial challenge") and show them another challenge ("real challenge") that will be object of the actual and sole competition. Due to this new decision, which does not affect the quality of the program and is in line with what the partners declared in the Application form, the overall course architecture should be adjusted. UniPi will revise the Training course Action Plan and will send a new version of the document by 10.04.2019. According to the new architecture, BIBA and URL will adjust their detailed training schedule. Presentation of the common parts developed by the Universities/companies --BIBA: Introduction about enterprise 4.0. Partnership__Feedback: Robert suggests the change of the name of this session from "Enterprise 4.0" to "Industry 4.0". The partners ask Robert to introduce a new slide for creating a link from this introduction to the other presentations/topics. --URL: 360 degrees of digitalization . Partnership__Feedback: the slides are ok. --Great Products: Market and business model understanding. Intooition/GP will present the slides soon --UNIPI: Audit methodology . Partnership__Feedback : the number of slides is too high for a 30 min presentation; UniPi should stress that the students can refer to IO1 (downloadable on the project website) for getting all the information about how to conduct a 4.0 audit. --URL: Why should I implement a specific technology? Partnership__Feedback: URL asks for a feedback from the companies about the 5 questions they put in the final slides. Partners will give a comment, if any, before the start of the course. Presentation of one example of the use cases template and discussion Luigi (TOI) presents the first use case to present in the course: "An innovative Waste-management system based on the acquisition of biogas data". This Use Case is referred to Data and Security topic. This presentation is also conceived as a test of the template prepared by Intooition. Main feedback on the template: --Luigi suggests not to use all the slides, but just the ones that are more relevant for the use case (for example, for this presentation he focused on internal processes, skipping other topics, such as stakeholders); --Regarding the specific company markets, Luigi could not get info from the company, so he made researches on internet: he suggests do this in case the other partners will have problem in getting this information; --Claudia (Intooition/GP) thinks that TOI should give more information on the state of the art of the technology descripted, on the solutions already available on the market and on the economic impact of the introduction of the new data acquisition method. It is important to understand if there is an economic impact, even without using numbers, but still giving an overview of the advantages and benefits of the company; --Alan (URL) asks for adding some slides about security related issues, in order to introduce this topic for their students. Luigi (TOI) will add the above mentioned suggestions in the new version of this use case (deadline: 18.03.2019). The partners agree on having all the use cases for the Introduction to the courses prepared by TOI. TOI will revise the use case on Biogas (especially meant for introducing "Big Data and Security" course) and will prepare two new presentations: one on Industrial refrigeration (specifically targeted on IIoT topic) and one on Manufacturing Industry (specifically targeted on "Production system automation" topic). The presentations will be standard, but Universities could ask to focus on some specific aspects when referring to the topic to be addressed in their course in order to introduce exercises/practical sessions for their students. Universities will ask to companies to provide them use cases if needed, but in general the exercises should be based TOI will deliver the 3 presentations by 10.05.2019. The partners will revise the materials and provide feedback on the standard slides by 17.05.2019. All the other modifications (specifically based on the specific needs of the Universities), will be agreed bilaterally by the involved partners. Update about the preparation of the specific training course materials and identification of possible support (uses cases) from the companies Robert (BIBA), Alan (URL) and Nicola (UniPi) presents the structure of the courses they designed. The overall architecture will be reviewed by UniPi considering the decision about the "trial" and "real" challenges, all the other partners will modify the specific schedules accordingly (Deadline UniPi: 10.04.2019). Alan will contact directly TOI and Intooition/GP for asking them the technologies he could introduce in the course and agreeing on the presentations. TOI will also prepare a more detailed version of the Data and Security use case (biogas) which will be the starting point for some exercises. Robert (BIBA) asks TOI to make a practical workshop of 90 minutes on their technologies. Luigi accepts; BIBA will contact directly Luigi for getting information about the equipment TOI needs for the implementation of the workshop. Nicola (UNIPI) asks to Luigi (TOI) to give a presentation on the 4.0box and the 4.0platform, in order to present these tools to the students. Luigi accepts; UniPi will liaise with Luigi for organizing the training sessions. Nicola (UNIPI) asks to Carl (OHS) to give a presentation on a use case on Automatic Maintenance, following the common template of the use cases. Carl accepts. Carl will provide the slides to UNIPI by 10.05.2019 and UNIPI will revise the material and provide feedback by 17.05.2019. The partners confirm the idea of choosing one idea as "trial" challenge, focusing more on technological aspects, and one "real" challenge, focusing also on business aspects (as provided by the prEtotype template that will be presented by Intooition/GP on the second day). Presentation of the companies challenges adopting the "Partner company presentation" (short version) and discussion for improvements Carl presents OHS and the two challenges ("Autmation Production System" and "Data & Security"), adopting the template. In general, Alessandro (TOI) thinks that the template should be used for giving a support to the companies for presenting the challenges, always considering that the students will also have the challenge canvas with the very core information. The slides should be a way for allowing the companies to tell a story to the students, explaining who they are (company presentation) and what they need (challenges). Carl (OHS) needs to rework the presentation to shorten it. He needs to add more information about the market data. Enzo presents Selettra and the two challenges ( IIoT and Data & Security ). Enzo had problems in filling the general presentation of the company, as it was not clear to him what market data and value chain meant. He suggests change the wording of the slide on "obstacles", adopting rather the terms "limits" or "boundaries". Ilaria (Intooition/GP) remarks that it is important for the students to have a wide picture of the company and its business model. The students should frame the company in its value chain, in order to provide solutions which are aligned with the company and that can be actually implemented. Ilaria explains that companies does not need to provide much detailed info about the market, but it is important to make the students understand what the companies really need. Jordi presents Barna Steel and the two challenges ( IIoT and Automation production system ). Jordi proposes to add a slide with "failures", explaining previous experiences which brought to no results. Jordi thinks that the challenge on the Exoskeleton could be not strategic any more for Barna Steel. By 05.04.2019 he will give UniPi a final answer about the challenge: if maintaining it or replacing it with another one, and which one. By 19.04.2019 Barna Stell will provide UniPi with the final version of the challenge they want to present in Pisa. Feedback on the use of the template provided by Intooition/GP The partners can take the small logos out. They are invited to add other pictures related to the contents they present Slide "Value chain": Intooition/GP will provide a more precise description and guide for filling this slide Slide "Key market data": one slide is enough, with key information about what the company feels it is important about their sector. Slide "Processes": in the current version of the presentations, there are many differences among partners. This slide should be more detailed (OHS could be considered as a good example), students need to understand clearly the workflow, they should understand exactly how the companies do things and what it is expected from them as improvement. Selettra should improve consistently the presentation, as at the moment being it is difficult to understand the process and how the tools they have are actually working. Slide "Stakeholder": students do not need a list of the people involved as stakeholder, but they need to understand the information workflow. The example to take is the slide that OHS prepared. Slide "Impact": it is important for the students to know which is the impact expected and they should have the idea of measurable indicators. How to measure the impact? This would be an important info for understanding the challenge and this would allow the students to provide solutions that can represent an actual added value for companies. Exoskeleton: it is more a solution than a challenge. Ilaria thinks that a possibile challenge on this topic could focus on the problem of handling or moving certain materials in the specific environment of the company. Hence the students will provide a solution among the technologies tackled during the course. Deadlines: Intooition/GP will send an updated version of the company description presentation by 29.03.2019 Companies will define the new version of the slides and the canvas of the Challenges by 19.04.2019. If needed the Universities can contact the companies for receiving additional information from the companies. Both the presentation and the canvas should be completed and released in an ultimate version by that deadline. Partners decided which is the "real challenge" and the "trial challenge". The picture is here below. The University partners are also asked to provide the dates for the University coaching and the expected dates for the mobility here . According to this scheme: --SELETTRA will present the trial challenge for the students of the Spanish course (Data and Security) and the real challenge for the students of the German course (IIoT) --OHS will present the trial challenge for the students of the Italian course (Production system automation) and the real challenge for the students of the Spanish course (Data and Security) --Barna Steel will present the trial challenge for the students of the German course (IIoT) and the real challenge for the students of the Italian course (Production system automation) This means that: --UniPi will present the challenge of OHS as trial challenge and the challenge of Barna Steel as real challenge --BIBA will present the challenge of Barna Steel as trial challenge and the challenge of SELETTRA as real challenge --URL will present the challenge of Selettra as trial challenge and the challenge of OHS as real challenge Presentation of the Pretoype Competition Action Plan Nicola (UniPi) presents the PrEtotype Action Plan (full document here ). The summary of the open issues and partners feedback/partnership decisions is here below: Presentation of what is a PrEtotype : this presentation will be prepared by UniPi; partners will allocate 1 hour for this. Deadline: updated version for partners check: 30.04.2019; ultimate version after partnership validation by 31.05.2019 Group creation : partners discuss about the methodology proposed by UniPi for creating the groups. Robert agrees on the rationale for the proposal (Universities contribute significantly to the creation of the groups, taking students from different Faculties), but he thinks it will be difficult for them to have people coming from many different Faculties. URL suggests the Universities creating the groups, without asking to the students. Universities will be free of deciding which is the most effective way for creating the groups, taking into account the proposal of UniPi. Output for the "trial" and "real" challenges : a) Trial challenges have a flexible output, it should be focused on technologies and ideas. Robert suggests to a have as output a quick pitch on a single page output to be evaluated by the other students ("shark-tank" methodology). Robert (BIBA) will provide a draft procedure for this exercise by 10.04.2019. b) Real challenges : slide presentation, based on the template prepared by Intooition/GP and to be presented on the 2
docs.title: partnership meeting minutes

docs.text: day of the meeting. How to evaluate the challenges : UniPi will prepare a grid starting from the set of common criteria already listed in the Pretotype Action Plan. UniPi will introduce other criteria, such as the quality of the presentations. It is compulsory that the students participating in the mobility must be linked to the organization granting them (e.g. they are officially enrolled). These channels should be exploited to reach the students. UNIPI will also create a Linkedin group for reaching the students which are already registered. Revision of the flyer: adding the fact that there is possibility of having a fully paid transnational mobility. Brainstorming on IO5: Coaching methodologies (Technology coaching – Universities; Application oriented coaching – Companies) for empowering competencies and for elaborating prototypes according to Industry 4.0 The first question asked by Nicola (UniPi) is: what do the companies expect from the students at the end of the mobility? --Enzo (Selettra): he expects the students to be able to provide ideas and solutions to solve the problems presented by the company during the challenge. --Jordi (Barna Steel): he expects, at the end of the path, to have a proof of concept to be further developed, in other words a deeper analysis of the problem and a number of ideas for actually solving it. --Carl (OHS) has the same objectives. He hopes the students will be able to work within the company with a good degree of autonomy and organize their work by themselves. For sure, he will provide them with all the support they need, but it is important for them to develop also autonomy as a skill. Alan (URL) believes that the students should just solve a part of the problem, and provide for this part a proof of concept, transforming the pretotype presented in the competition and developed thanks to the Technology coaching (host University) into a prototype (thanks to the company coaching). The students should prove that the problem is solvable; the company will then have the chance for completing the work. - - Technology Coaching (within the University) : the output of this first kind of coaching should be a preliminary action/project plan, to be deployed for real during the transnational mobility within the company. The Project Plan could be composed of: --WPs/Phases with at least one output per each phase and/or list of tasks organized on a weekly base --GANTT chart --Expected effort expressed in time --List of resources needed --The expected impact in the company (improvements) - - Application oriented coaching (within the Company) : the output should be a proof of concept, to be further developed by the company. While in the Technology Coaching phase the students will plan the work to do ( planning ), in the Application oriented coaching they will implement the plan ( doing ). During the mobility the students should also focus on business aspects, dedicating at least a couple of days for understanding and defining the business prospective of the prototype developed in the previous days. To do this, the students could be asked to carry out a SWOT analysis (or some more sophisticate tool) for defining how the company business could be changed by the introduction of the protoyped solution. Also the stakeholder analysis could be useful to understand the external relations that could be created in a following implementation phase The results of this brainstorming should be conceived just as suggestion for the organization(s) responsible for preparing these methodologies (being Intootion/GP or other organizations in case they should leave the partnership). As the first coaching will take place in September in Spain (duration: 1 month, after the end of the course and summer break, more info here ), the methodologies should be ready by the end of July. A more detailed plan will be prepared when the decision about the partner organizations wil be taken. Recap on financial and administrative rules related to the Teaching and students mobilities for participating in the 3 training courses Alessandro (TOI) presents the financial rules, which are fully described in the slides here . University and companies are asked to understand if there are any specific administrative rules they need to comply with for sending out/hosting the students. The University could also check with their Erasmus+ internal offices if there are any specific rules to follow for the students mobility. In case of need, they can always refer to UniPi for support and counselling. Companies might also ask the students to sign a Non-Disclosure Agreement (NDA). UniPi will provide the partners with the common documents for the mobility, such as a template agreement between the Universities and the students, the learning agreement for the students (linking the University, the students and the company) and the template Europass certificate, for certifying the skills developed during the mobility. It could be also useful to give the students a certificate of attendance (as required by the financial rules of the program) and a Job Reference/Testimonial certificate (for enriching the CVs) Planning next steps, training mobilites, students mobilities and next meeting (Dec 2019 – Barcelona, host by Barna) Next steps: --UniPi revise of the Training course Action Plan: 10.05.2019 --Barna informs UniPi about the challenge to replace (or not) the exoskeleton challenge: 05.04.2019 --Preparation of Training course common materials (UniPi, URL, BIBA, Intooition/GP) and common Introduction to PrEtotype (UniPI): updated version for partners check: 30.04.2019; ultimate version after partnership validation by 31.05.2019. --BIBA prepares a draft proposal for presenting the output of the "trial" challenge. 10.04.2019 --OHS will prepare a a presentation on a use case on Automatic Maintenance, following the common template of the use cases by 10.05.2019. UNIPI will revise the material and provide feedback by 17.05.2019. --Preparation of the use cases (TOI): first version for partners check: 10.05.2019; partners check the materials by 17.05.2019. Universities can ask for specific improvements with the purpose of introducing practical exercises on the use case issues. --Luigi (TOI) will contact BIBA and URL for organizing workshops and the other training pars to be delivered by TOI --Any additional materials needed by the Universities from TOI or other partners: based on direct contacts among the involved partners --Final version of companies presentations and challenges canvas: 19.04.2019 --Course structure and syllabus defined by the universities: 31.05.2019. Partners will prepare the related training materials basing on internal deadlines (clearly, the final deadline for this is the begin of the course) --Coaching methodologies (University and Company): first draft by 30.04.2019, delivery of an improved version by 31.05.2019; the partners will take advantage of the gathering for the URL training course (Mon 08.07.2019 – Fri 12.07.2019) --FGB send an updated version of the evaluation and communication tools: 12.04.2019 Next meeting should take place in December, partnership will agree on the dates. The meeting should be hosted by Barna Steel, but the Spanish partners are invited to discuss if it would be possible to choose as meeting venue URL premises, so to avoid logistic difficulties to the other partners.
